Checklist Item (Raw): Exterior path surface is firm, stable, slip-resistant
Bronze: Surface is stable/firm/slip-resistant; level changes ≤ 6 mm; no abrupt lips.
Silver: All segments well-drained, cane-detectable edges provided at hazards.
Gold: Consistent texture/contrast cues; integrated tactile edges on all primary routes; no ponding.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | Exterior & Paths | Parking/Loading

Bronze: ≥ 36 in (915 mm) along the whole maintained route.
Silver: ≥ 44 in (1120 mm) on primary approach routes.
Gold: ≥ 72 in (1828 mm) preferred on primary approaches to allow two devices side-by-side.

Checklist Item (Raw): Turning area at exterior direction changes
Bronze: Turning area provided as needed (≥ 60 in diameter).
Silver: Turning area ≥ 67 in (1700 mm) at major changes.
Gold: Turning area ≥ 83 in (2110 mm) at key nodes to accommodate large power chairs.

Bronze: Where ramped: running slope ≤ 1:12; cross-slope ≤ 1:50.
Silver: Long runs designed at ≤ 1:20 wherever feasible.
Gold: Routing avoids ramps where grades permit; slopes ≤ 1:30 where possible.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Elevators/Stairs | Exterior & Paths | Parking/Loading

Bronze: Weather protection at passenger loading or immediate entrance threshold.
Silver: Covered pause area outside the travel path for orientation; non-glare lighting.
Gold: Covered, well-lit wayfinding node with tactile map/QR and seating off the route.

Checklist Item (Raw): Tactile walking surface indicators (TWSI) used where line of travel is ambiguous
Bronze: Used at curb ramps and changes in level.
Silver: Used to delineate vehicle/pedestrian edges and decision points.
Gold: Continuous tactile guide path from site arrival to entry with contrasting material.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Elevators/Stairs | Entrance | Exterior & Paths | Parking/Loading

Bronze: Accessible entrance signed at decision points.
Silver: Wayfinding signs meet or exceed legibility guidance at low/high viewing heights.
Gold: Cues perceptible at varying distances in two or more formats (visual/audible/tactile).
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Entrance | Exterior & Paths | Parking/Loading

Checklist Item (Raw): Entry forecourt free of protruding hazards
Bronze: Headroom ≥ 80 in; objects between 27–80 in project ≤ 4 in.
Silver: Projecting elements mitigated by wing walls or guards on all primary approaches.
Gold: All elements recessed or cane-detectable; zero unexpected projections on routes.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | Entrance | Exterior & Paths | Parking/Loading | Security/Access Control

Checklist Item (Raw): Exterior seating/rest spots provided along long approaches
Bronze: At least one rest spot near main entrance.
Silver: Rest spots ≈ every 30 m (98 ft) along long approaches, off the path.
Gold: Multiple rest types (bench with arms, perch, wheelchair companion space) at each node.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | Entrance | Exterior & Paths | Parking/Loading

Checklist Item (Raw): Exterior lighting reduces glare and shadows
Bronze: Adequate illumination at entries and paths; no dark gaps.
Silver: Downward-directed, even lighting with minimal glare sources.
Gold: Adaptive controls maintain uniformity; avoid floodlights that create harsh shadows.

Bronze: Manual door meets force/speed/threshold basics; assistance method available.
Silver: Exterior doors are automatic or power-assist; labeled.
Gold: Exterior doors fully automatic (sensor) plus redundant low-tech actuator (vertical paddle).
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | Entrance | Exterior & Paths | Parking/Loading

Bronze: Clear opening ≥ 32 in (813 mm).
Silver: Clear opening ≥ 36 in (915 mm).
Gold: Clear opening ≥ 40 in (1015 mm); ≥ 42 in (1067 mm) preferred at high-traffic entries.

Bronze: Landing 60 x 60 in, aligned to hinge side.
Silver: Add depth per closer/latch conditions; doors in series maintain required spacing.
Gold: Generous landings beyond minimums at all public-facing doors; vestibules biased to one-swing direction to ease flow.

Bronze: From 70° to 3 in from latch ≥ 3 s.
Silver: ≥ 5 s closing time where heavy usage or cognitive/sensory needs warrant.
Gold: Closers tuned for low effort and quiet operation; observable open dwell on autos for independent passage.

Bronze: ≤ 5 lbf (22.2 N) for interior doors.
Silver: ≤ 3 lbf for commonly used interior doors where feasible.
Gold: Balanced hinges/low-friction hardware; power-assist on heavy/oversized doors.

Bronze: Operable with closed fist; lever/push/pull type; 1½ in knuckle clearance.
Silver: No simultaneous actions or fine dexterity required anywhere.
Gold: Large-format pulls/paddles; tactile orientation mark on keypad locks; dual-height peepholes/vision lites where used.

Bronze: No abrupt vertical rise > 6 mm (¼ in) or beveled to ½ in.
Silver: Zero-threshold preferred with recessed mats.
Gold: Documented maintenance to keep thresholds level year-round; floor transitions beveled and smooth.

Bronze: Clear space between doors: 48 in + width of any door swinging into the space.
Silver: Doors swing in same direction or away from the inter-door space.
Gold: Vestibules oversized to permit straight-through travel with mobility devices and service animals.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Entrance | Exterior & Paths | Service Animal Relief Area

Bronze: Manifestation provided on full-lite doors and adjacent sidelites.
Silver: Bands provided at multiple heights for varied sightlines.
Gold: Lower band around 12 in (300 mm) and higher bands 33.5–63 in (850–1600 mm) continuous/contrasting.

Bronze: Entry labeled with ADA-conformant signage.
Silver: Approach warnings in two modalities where sightlines are limited.
Gold: Approach cues combine visual/tactile/audible to indicate opposing traffic through doors.

Bronze: ≥ 36 in (915 mm) continuous.
Silver: ≥ 44 in (1120 mm) in main spines and lobbies.
Gold: ≥ 67 in (1700 mm) for primary spines where feasible.
≥ 72 in (1828 mm) where room size allows.

Checklist Item (Raw): Passing spaces provided on long corridors
Bronze: Passing spaces every 200 ft (61 m) or at nodes.
Silver: Passing spaces every 100 ft (30 m); alcoves off the path.
Gold: Frequent lay-bys/alcoves with power/seat integrated; never obstruct the route.

Bronze: Objects 27–80 in AFF project ≤ 4 in; headroom ≥ 80 in.
Silver: All projections either recessed or cane-detectable.
Gold: Zero surprises: guards/wing walls wherever projections cannot be recessed.

Bronze: Secure carpet; pile ≤ ½ in; beveled transitions.
Silver: Transitions ≤ 6 mm with bevel; visual quiet patterns at junctions.
Gold: Zero-threshold transitions wherever possible, consistent texture cues at changes.

Bronze: Unobstructed visual connection to reception, elevators, restrooms.
Silver: Wayfinding at decision points; lines of sight reinforced by lighting/contrast.
Gold: Redundant cues (visual/tactile/audible) at key nodes; low-glare illumination.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Elevators/Stairs | Lobby | Reception Desks | Restrooms | Work Floor

Bronze: Meets ADA legibility and placement guidance.
Silver: Available at multiple heights/distances; consistent program; tactile where appropriate.
Gold: Perceptible in ≥ 2 formats (visual/audible/tactile); maps available in print/QR with phone interaction.

Checklist Item (Raw): Provisions for scooters and large mobility devices
Bronze: Some rooms can accommodate scooters.
Silver: Extra maneuvering space planned in 25% of workpoints.
Gold: Charging alcoves and parking lay-bys off circulation; wide turning radii at nodes.

Checklist Item (Raw): Interior lighting for routes and decision points
Bronze: Adequate non-glare illumination; 5 fc at elevator lobbies.
Silver: Key features emphasized by lighting; controls within reach; alarms with ≥75 cd strobes where provided.
Gold: Adaptive daylight sensors; individual control at nearby work zones; glare control via baffles/overhangs.

Bronze: All levels connected by elevator/ramp/lift.
Silver: Destination dispatch with tactile call and vertical actuator provided.
Gold: Elevator on primary desire line; lobby sized for group waiting and turning.

Bronze: Cab accommodates 60 in turning; Braille and audible floor announcements.
Silver: Cab accommodates 67 in turning; large, illuminated buttons; Braille everywhere.
Gold: Alternative keypad layout option; door dwell adjustable; handrails for balance.

Bronze: Uniform risers/treads; handrails extend 12 in and return.
Silver: Color-contrasting nosings and landings; tactile indicators at top.
Gold: Even, low-glare lighting; ≤10 risers per flight where feasible; rest perches nearby.

Bronze: Compliant slopes/landings; handrails per code.
Silver: Longest runs held at ≤ 1:20 where feasible; tactile indicators at landings.
Gold: Routing preference eliminates ramps; if present, add weather protection and rest zones.

Bronze: ≥ 36 in clear paths around furniture.
Silver: ≥ 36 in clear paths with removable elements to expand as needed.
Gold: ≥ 67 in turning circles in enclosed team rooms and private offices.

Checklist Item (Raw): Reach to desk controls and accessories
Bronze: All controls within 36–48 in reach range.
Silver: Duplicate critical controls within 15–48 in reach.
Gold: Dual-height or adjustable interfaces where feasible at every primary workpoint.

Bronze: Varied seating types; some with arms.
Silver: ≥ 33% of seats with arms; tables with knee/toe clearance provided.
Gold: Full spectrum of heights and seat types; reserveable accessible seating options.

Bronze: 36 in clear around table; doors/AV do not block path.
Silver: 67 in turning where room allows; chair layout keeps egress paths clear when occupied.
Gold: Adjustable-height tables; writable surfaces ≤ 34 in high for seated use.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | Entrance | IT/AV & Kiosks | Meeting Room | Work Floor

Bronze: Some seats have accessible power.
Silver: Accessible power within 24 in of table edge in collaboration zones.
Gold: Power at every seat in major rooms; cord management avoids tripping.

Bronze: Avoid excessive hard-surface echo; quiet equipment specified.
Silver: Acoustic treatments per space type; focus zones identified.
Gold: Acoustic and visual barriers create low-stimulus zones throughout.

Bronze: No direct glare on screens where practicable.
Silver: Daylight with blinds/baffles; task lights provided.
Gold: Automated daylight control stabilizes levels; no fluorescent sources at desks.

Bronze: Provide a mix of collaboration and focus furniture.
Silver: Signal systems to indicate collaboration availability at desks.
Gold: Individualized lighting/temperature controls in focus rooms; adjustable seating for all body types.

Bronze: Placed on accessible routes with 30x48 in clear floor space.
Silver: UI at 36–48 in; large font/high contrast; headphone jack for audio where device supports it.
Gold: Alternative input methods (mobile release/NFC) and tactile orientation on key controls.

Bronze: No lockers below 15 in AFF; accessible items within 15–48 in.
Silver: 60 in side reach clearance; lower rail ≤ 48 in; tactile numbering with Braille.
Gold: Dual-height rails (e.g., 48 in & 66 in); contrasting finishes for door/lock definition.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Entrance | Gym/Fitness | Work Floor

Bronze: Counters ≤ 34 in (860 mm).
Silver: Multiple counter heights in larger hubs.
Gold: All primary counters provide an accessible section; adjustable where feasible.

Bronze: Depth 10–24 in; items stored near front edge.
Silver: Water/ice controls within 11 in of edge for reach.
Gold: All controls duplicate at accessible height and reach.

Bronze: 30 x 48 in clear at sink, dishwasher, microwave.
Silver: Door swings planned to preserve clear spaces when open.
Gold: Opposing clearances allow approach from multiple sides.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | Entrance | Kitchenette (Work Floor)

Bronze: Side-mounted taps; no-touch soap/towel where possible.
Silver: All primary fixtures are no-touch.
Gold: All fixtures are no-touch with manual fallback; maintenance plan verified.

Bronze: At least one accessible table per area.
Silver: Variety of table heights; routes through furniture kept clear.
Gold: Accessible seating options reserveable; companion spaces at communal tables.

Bronze: Writing/typing/app option available upon request.
Silver: Tools proactively available and visible.
Gold: Independent ordering without staff interaction is available and private.

Bronze: Non-glare, high contrast, readable at 1 ft.
Silver: Available in multiple locations/heights.
Gold: Information in ≥ 2 formats (visual + audible/tactile on request).

Bronze: All products/amenity controls within 15–48 in.
Silver: Duplicate popular items at low and high shelves.
Gold: Vertical stocking policy enforced; Braille & large-font labels used consistently.

Checklist Item (Raw): Single-user restroom: lavatory clearance and height
Bronze: Lavatory rim ≤ 34 in; knee/toe clearance provided; pipes insulated.
Silver: Clear floor space 30x48 in at lavatory and dispensers; mirror bottom ≤ 40 in.
Gold: All dispensers within 15–48 in; shelf to keep items off floor provided.

Bronze: Stall door clear opening ≥ 32 in; 18 in latch-side space if out-swinging at aisle end.
Silver: Toe clearances under partitions ≥ 9 in high on front and one side.
Gold: Out-swing doors wherever feasible; latch/handles operable with closed fist.

Bronze: Grab bars 33–36 in AFF.
Silver: Additional positions as needed for transfers.
Gold: Options for adjustable or supplemental bars where permitted.

Bronze: Some functions (water/soap/towel) no-touch.
Silver: All primary functions no-touch.
Gold: All functions no-touch plus manual fallback; maintenance tested.

Bronze: One accessible urinal; rim ≤ 17 in; 30x48 in approach.
Silver: Privacy panels ≥ 29 in apart and not projecting beyond rim; flush ≤ 44 in.
Gold: At least one adult changing shelf nearby where program requires.

Bronze: At least one single-user restroom available.
Silver: Family restroom includes shelf/ledge and panic/emergency alarm.
Gold: Adult height-adjustable changing bench provided where program requires.

Bronze: At least one accessible shower per gender and one all-gender.
Silver: Curtains separate wet/dry areas; protect mobility devices from water.
Gold: Seat, grab bars, handheld shower on slide bar; low-glare lighting.

Bronze: Accessible sink (front approach) and clearances provided.
Silver: Under-counter accessible refrigerator; adjustable seating; quiet space signage.
Gold: Customizable temperature and lighting controls; view to nature or biophilic finishes.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Kitchenette (Work Floor) | Restrooms | Sensory Rooms | Wellness/Lactation

Bronze: Accessories within 15–48 in; do not protrude > 4 in if in path.
Silver: High-contrast labels; Braille on key dispensers.
Gold: Dual locations (low/high) for frequently used accessories.

Checklist Item (Raw): Potty parity and capacity planning (multi-user restrooms)
Bronze: Baseline fixture counts meet local requirement.
Silver: Parity plan addresses typical female wait times; added fixtures/rooms where feasible.
Gold: Queuing and circulation modeled; additional rooms provided to equalize waits.

Bronze: Hook/shelf available; location within reach.
Silver: Secure, accessible storage in single-user spaces.
Gold: Storage provided in both stalls and sink areas to keep belongings off floor.

Checklist Item (Raw): Emergency call and refuge features in single-user spaces
Bronze: Visual/audible alarm devices present where required.
Silver: Emergency pull-strings/buttons within reach at floor and near WC.
Gold: Two-way communication with staff; clear signage for assistance.

Bronze: Audible alarms accompanied by visual strobes ≥ 75 cd.
Silver: Pre-alert announcements (visual or audible) before loud alarms.
Gold: Redundant messaging across PA, displays, and personal devices; intelligible in noise.

Bronze: Announcements provided verbally or visually on request.
Silver: Announcements delivered in ≥ 2 formats (visual/audible/tactile).
Gold: Status available in app/personal devices; visible from multiple locations.

Bronze: Accessible signage lists accessibility features onsite.
Silver: Features listed online and kept current.
Gold: Real-time status of accessibility features/services in app and on web.

Bronze: Tools available on request (writing/typing/app).
Silver: Tools proactively visible and available.
Gold: Independent, private non-speech options integrated with operations.

Bronze: High contrast, non-glare, appropriate font sizes.
Silver: Info available in multiple locations, readable at varied heights/distances.
Gold: Info available in ≥ 2 formats (visual + audible/tactile).

Checklist Item (Raw): Room identification and directional signage program
Bronze: Meets ADA basics for character size/contrast and mounting.
Silver: Consistent placement; well illuminated; includes pictograms where helpful.
Gold: Alternate languages and pictograms; interactive map/QR that works with personal devices.

Bronze: Controls within 15–48 in (front approach) or 9–54 in (side) and operable without grip/pinch/twist.
Silver: 30x48 in clear floor space provided at controls; switches organized to match fixtures.
Gold: Dual-height controls for critical functions; personal control of lighting where possible.

Bronze: Some conference rooms equipped with assistive listening and captioning.
Silver: All large rooms have assistive listening; captioning planned for most meetings.
Gold: Default-on captions in conferencing systems; microphone and audio loops in major rooms.

Bronze: At least 50% wheelchair accessible; spout heights for seated users.
Silver: Fountains at more than one height; clear 30x48 in approach.
Gold: Bottle fillers at accessible height; controls operable with closed fist.

Bronze: Amenities on accessible paths with 30x48 in clearance.
Silver: Amenities located to the side of the direct path of travel.
Gold: Amenities grouped conveniently with consistent signage and clear space.

Bronze: Operable without tight grasping; not protruding > 4 in into route.
Silver: Located off primary path; within 15–48 in reach.
Gold: Grouped with other amenities; lids counterbalanced or open-frame.

Bronze: Nearby outdoor area identified.
Silver: Relief area signed and kept; waste supplies provided.
Gold: Covered relief area near entries with wayfinding; hygienic maintenance plan.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | Entrance | Exterior & Paths | Kitchenette (Work Floor) | Parking/Loading | Service Animal Relief Area

Silver: Power and junction box stubbed at critical doors for future operators.
Gold: Documented conduit paths and control stubs in O&M for rapid conversion.

Silver: Extra maneuvering space in select workpoints and corridors.
Gold: Dedicated charging/parking alcoves off circulation routes across floors.

Checklist Item (Raw): Flexible wall systems for adjustable heights
Silver: Select wall systems allow adjustable shelves/outlets/displays.
Gold: Programmed strategy to update heights as workforce needs change.

Checklist Item (Raw): Vestibule clear length (two doors in series)
Bronze: Clear length between doors ≥ 48 in + width of any door swinging into space.
Silver: Clear length exceeds minimum by ≥ 12 in.
Gold: Clear length sized so a mobility device and companion can pause without blocking swings.

Bronze: If provided, viewer placed within 43–48 in AFF.
Silver: Dual-height viewers or glazing.
Gold: Wide glazing panel for sightlines from seated/standing approaches.

Bronze: Provided at staffed entrances.
Silver: Provided at all public-facing manual entries.
Gold: Provided with visual+audible feedback; reachable within 15–48 in; weather-protected.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Entrance | Exterior & Paths | Parking/Loading

Bronze: Carpet pile ≤ 1/2 in; firm backing; transitions beveled.
Silver: Low-pattern, low-contrast transitions to minimize visual noise.
Gold: Flooring chosen for high LRVs with controlled contrast at decision points.

Bronze: Key nodes have contrast to aid navigation.
Silver: Contrast used to mark routes vs seating areas.
Gold: Integrated tactile striping/contrasting flooring bands at all decision nodes.

Checklist Item (Raw): Elevator call button height and feedback
Bronze: Call buttons at 36–48 in; tactile/Braille provided.
Silver: Audible+visual feedback on calls; wait-time indicators.
Gold: Destination dispatch offers keypad and vertical actuator; redundancy provided.

Bronze: Graspable profile, continuous, returns to wall.
Silver: Ends contrast-marked; tactile change at landings.
Gold: Dual-height rails where feasible (34–38 in primary; auxiliary for children/short stature).

Bronze: Writable surfaces ≤ 48 in top of writing area; usable seated.
Silver: Primary whiteboards ≤ 34 in writing height provided in shared spaces.
Gold: Height-adjustable or dual-height writing surfaces in all meeting rooms.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | IT/AV & Kiosks | Meeting Room | Work Floor

Bronze: Within 36–48 in; operable without grip.
Silver: On-screen high-contrast 'Accessibility Mode' available.
Gold: Physical/tactile controls mirrored in app; captions default-on for in-room displays.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | IT/AV & Kiosks | Meeting Room | Work Floor

Bronze: At least one unit with controls within 15–48 in.
Silver: All commonly used appliances have accessible units.
Gold: All appliances are accessible or duplicated at accessible height with clear knee space.

Bronze: 36 in aisles with chairs pushed in.
Silver: 36 in aisles maintained with chairs occupied (plan furniture).
Gold: ≥ 44 in primary aisles; queueing areas do not block routes.

Bronze: TP centerline ≤ 36 in from back wall; ≥ 19 in AFF.
Silver: Accessories placed to not obstruct grab bars.
Gold: Large-format dispensers allow single-hand tear; continuous paper delivery.

Bronze: At least one mirror bottom edge ≤ 40 in.
Silver: Full-height mirror provided.
Gold: Full-height mirror plus additional at seated height near accessible lavatory.

Bronze: High-contrast themes available on request.
Silver: Accessibility Mode offered (large font/high contrast, audio with headphones).
Gold: Persistent user profile for preferences with privacy controls.

Bronze: List exists and is findable.
Silver: Kept current (reviewed quarterly).
Gold: Real-time status shown in app/web; outage notifications posted on-site and online.

Bronze: Standard evacuation maps posted at key locations.
Silver: Maps include tactile/Braille where feasible; refuge areas signed.
Gold: Multi-format messaging and drills inclusive of people with disabilities.

Checklist Item (Raw): Inclusive evacuation drills & personal egress planning (PEEPs)
Bronze: Evacuation plans posted; refuge areas identified; visual+audible alarms.
Silver: Annual inclusive evacuation drill; signage includes refuge; PEEPs offered/maintained.
Gold: Dynamic PEEP program; inclusive drills across all groups; trained assistance protocols.

Bronze: Emergency lighting on accessible routes provided.
Silver: Backup power for at least one accessible elevator and main auto-operators.
Gold: All critical accessibility systems on backup with documented O&M plan.

Bronze: Audible alarms paired with strobes meeting intensity requirements.
Silver: Strobes supplemented with tactile devices where needed; visual pre-alerts.
Gold: Alerts delivered redundantly to personal devices (text/app/wearable haptics).
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Elevators/Stairs | IT/AV & Kiosks | Meeting Room

Bronze: Audible cues present in evacuation routes.
Silver: Audio beacons at refuge areas and exits.
Gold: Real-time navigation assistance (tactile or app-based) guiding users to safety.

Checklist Item (Raw): Emergency visual alert usability for low vision
Bronze: Strobes meet intensity and distribution requirements.
Silver: Alerts supplemented with pulsing colored beacons (not just flashes).
Gold: Multimodal alerts with calmer visual/haptic options; personal device integration.

Bronze: Two-way comm includes text display in cab (not audio-only).
Silver: Induction loop or Auracast/BT broadcast available.
Gold: Video remote interpreting + text; tactile instructions adjacent to comm panel.

Bronze: Weather/security alerts posted on digital boards.
Silver: Mirrored to personal devices (text/app) with clear language templates.
Gold: Multimodal with location-aware routing; inclusive checks in drills.

Bronze: Strobe flash rates comply with seizure-safe guidance.
Silver: Option for pulsing or color-shift beacons in sensitive zones.
Gold: Personal alert profiles allow calmer visual/haptic patterns.

Bronze: HVAC meets code ventilation/filtration; avoid heavy fragrances in common spaces.
Silver: Low-VOC finishes specified; fragrance-reduced cleaning products.
Gold: IAQ monitoring visible to occupants; cleaning plans co-developed with sensitivity input.

Bronze: Some natural light/planting in common areas.
Silver: Circulation nodes include biophilic finishes (plants, textures, daylight/nature imagery).
Gold: Multi-sensory restorative areas at rest stops and wellness spaces.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Sensory Rooms | Wellness/Lactation | Work Floor

Bronze: Accessibility features listed on intranet/visitor packet.
Silver: Features listed online, kept current, accessible to visitors.
Gold: Real-time accessible routes/outage notices/amenities in app and web.

Bronze: Static QR codes link to accessible maps.
Silver: Interactive kiosk/app offers accessible route planning with voice/tactile feedback.
Gold: Real-time wayfinding integrated with building services and personal devices.

Bronze: Accessibility info available via app/QR.
Silver: Tested with at least one mainstream screen reader.
Gold: WCAG 2.2 AA compliant; tested with multiple ATs and user feedback.

Bronze: Standard cleaning/inspection plan in place.
Silver: Accessibility-specific checklist for auto-operators, thresholds, tactile surfaces, lighting.
Gold: Formal accessibility O&M tracked; SLAs; user reps in review.

Bronze: TWSIs at stair/ramp tops.
Silver: Tactile strips at decision points on major routes.
Gold: Continuous tactile guide path entrance→lobby→amenities→exits.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Elevators/Stairs | Entrance | IT/AV & Kiosks | Lobby

Bronze: Large-print and Braille directory at main entrance.
Silver: Tactile maps at major floor lobbies.
Gold: Orientation landmarking (texture/sound/scent) at decision points.

Bronze: Locator tones at reception/elevator cores.
Silver: Beacons at restrooms/decision nodes.
Gold: Beacon network integrated with indoor navigation app.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Elevators/Stairs | Entrance | IT/AV & Kiosks | Lobby | Reception Desks | Restrooms

Checklist Item (Raw): Handrail tactile floor IDs at stairs
Bronze: Tactile floor number at each stair landing.
Silver: Add tactile exit direction on handrails.
Gold: Tactile/visual maps at primary stair lobbies showing exits/refuge.

Bronze: Permanent room IDs: raised text + Grade-2 Braille, 48–60″ AFF at latch side.
Silver: Consistent placement; high-contrast; non-glare.
Gold: Program includes tactile arrows + floor/wing identifiers at decision points.

Bronze: Door/wall contrast ≥ 30 LRV points.
Silver: Hardware/frames/floor edges marked with high-contrast strips.
Gold: Full contrast program across surfaces; tactile + visual cues integrated.

Bronze: ADA-compliant fonts, non-glare, high contrast.
Silver: Sans-serif ≥ 24 pt equivalent; consistent pictograms.
Gold: Large-format at decision points; digital signs with magnification/contrast modes.

Bronze: General lighting non-glare, ≥ 5 fc.
Silver: Individual dimmable task lighting at workpoints and meeting tables.
Gold: App/desk-based control of intensity and color temperature.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | IT/AV & Kiosks | Meeting Room | Work Floor

Bronze: Arrows/symbols on wall-mounted signs.
Silver: Large pictograms on floors/walls at junctions.
Gold: Multi-sensory orientation (contrast markings + tactile arrows + audible beacon).

Bronze: Manifestation at two heights on full-height glass.
Silver: Continuous high-contrast bands; low-glare finishes.
Gold: Edge protection/guards; extend patterns to sidelites/clerestories as needed.

Bronze: Non-glare displays; high-contrast themes.
Silver: Zoom/magnification and high-contrast selectable at kiosks.
Gold: Screen-reader support with headphone pairing; large-text preset.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | IT/AV & Kiosks | Security/Access Control | Work Floor

Bronze: Contrasting nosing on first/last tread.
Silver: Continuous ≥ 2″ contrast strip on all treads, non-slip, non-glare.
Gold: Contrast wraps nosing edge for depth perception.

Bronze: Projections limited per code in corridors.
Silver: All open-space elements designed cane-detectable.
Gold: No overhead <80″ AFF in circulation/waiting; elements recessed/guarded.

Bronze: Audible floor announcements + visual display; raised text + Braille.
Silver: Adjustable announcement volume/speed; distinct door earcons.
Gold: Destination dispatch with keypad + vertical actuator; personal-device pairing.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | Elevators/Stairs | Entrance | IT/AV & Kiosks

Bronze: Operable without color-only cues; basic text labels.
Silver: Tactile keypad, audio via headphone jack, volume control; screen-reader mode.
Gold: WCAG-conformant UX; QR handoff to personal device; privacy screen option.

Bronze: Readers 36–48″ AFF; audible success/failure tones.
Silver: Haptic + visible text/icon feedback; tactile alignment guides.
Gold: App/NFC pairing alternative; no color-only status indicators.

Bronze: At least one wide gate per bank; cane-detectable bases.
Silver: Clear visual/haptic/audible passage indicators; no overhead obstructions <80″.
Gold: Minimized visual clutter; tactile queue strips; ALS at staffed points.

Bronze: Noise/reverberation controlled in meeting rooms.
Silver: Open offices ≤ NC 35; RT60 ≤ 0.6s in key spaces.
Gold: Modeled acoustics; <0.4s RT60 where feasible; verify with STI.
Spaces: IT/AV & Kiosks | Meeting Room | Work Floor

Bronze: ALS in large meeting rooms/auditoriums.
Silver: ALS also at reception counters and small meeting rooms.
Gold: ALS coverage across public/amenity spaces; quarterly user testing.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Event Spaces | IT/AV & Kiosks | Kitchenette (Work Floor) | Lobby | Meeting Room | Reception Desks

Bronze: Captions available on request.
Silver: Captions always on for internal meetings/events.
Gold: Captions across signage/live streams/building comms; multilingual.
Spaces: Event Spaces | IT/AV & Kiosks | Meeting Room

Bronze: Audio announcements supplemented with text displays.
Silver: Messages via signage and push notifications.
Gold: Multichannel redundancy (audio/visual/app/haptics).

Bronze: AV/IT equipment shielded to prevent interference.
Silver: Quiet rooms with charging and maintenance tools.
Gold: Building-wide induction loop or Bluetooth broadcast; personal pairing supported.
Spaces: Event Spaces | IT/AV & Kiosks | Sensory Rooms | Wellness/Lactation

Bronze: Interpreters available for planned meetings upon request.
Silver: On-demand VRI in all meeting rooms and reception.
Gold: Interpreters (remote or in-person) within 15 minutes; enterprise service contract.
Spaces: IT/AV & Kiosks | Lobby | Meeting Room | Reception Desks

Checklist Item (Raw): Staff training & etiquette for Deaf access
Bronze: Basic Deaf awareness training for FOH staff.
Silver: Key staff trained in sign greetings and interpreter connection.
Gold: Annual enterprise-wide training on Deaf culture and access.

Bronze: Reserved seating with clear sightlines for interpreters/captions.
Silver: AV layouts with dual-display (presenter + interpreter video).
Gold: Universal meeting design: captioning + interpreter feed integrated on-site/remote.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Exterior & Paths | IT/AV & Kiosks | Meeting Room | Parking/Loading

Bronze: Emergency procedures available in written form.
Silver: Digital emergency guides include ASL/BSL videos.
Gold: Real-time emergency announcements with sign overlay on displays/mobile.

Bronze: Breakout spaces with circular or U-shaped seating.
Silver: Social areas with good sightlines, diffuse lighting, low glare.
Gold: Dynamic layouts and AV support for mixed Deaf/hearing groups.

Bronze: Face-lit speaker positions; avoid backlighting.
Silver: Dual-display layouts; reserved sightlines.
Gold: Platforms pinned to interpreters/captions by default; clear framing.
Spaces: IT/AV & Kiosks | Meeting Room | Security/Access Control

Bronze: Access to mobile speech-to-text apps.
Silver: Rooms equipped with transcription tablets/screens.
Gold: Enterprise AI transcription integrated and always available.

Bronze: Seating/lighting ensure direct sightlines to speakers.
Silver: Transparent masks/panels at reception where needed.
Gold: Staff trained on lipreader support (orientation, pacing).
Spaces: Café/Dining | IT/AV & Kiosks | Lobby | Reception Desks | Security/Access Control

Bronze: Reception/security can do written exchanges.
Silver: Messaging kiosks for visitor interaction.
Gold: Integrated chat-based service portals enterprise-wide.
Spaces: Café/Dining | IT/AV & Kiosks | Kitchenette (Work Floor) | Lobby | Reception Desks | Security/Access Control

Bronze: Audio paired with visible signage.
Silver: Digital push notifications for building-wide alerts.
Gold: Multichannel redundancy including tactile cues.

Bronze: Private space for written communication (HR/medical).
Silver: Secure digital messaging for sensitive topics.
Gold: Parity: live caption + text relay option for confidential exchanges.

Bronze: Live captions available (auto acceptable).
Silver: Target ≥ 90% accuracy for major meetings; human-edited post.
Gold: Enterprise SLA for high-accuracy live captions; multilingual.

Bronze: Reception/security can interact in writing.
Silver: Persistent chat channels for facilities/IT/HR.
Gold: All announcements mirrored to text channels with read receipts.
Spaces: IT/AV & Kiosks | Lobby | Reception Desks | Security/Access Control

Bronze: Color-coded signage paired with text labels.
Silver: Redundant coding via shape/pattern/icon.
Gold: Wayfinding never relies on color alone; tested with CVD simulators.

Bronze: Exit signs use illuminated text, not just color.
Silver: Alarms/beacons use pulsing patterns/shapes plus color.
Gold: Full multimodal alerting (color + text + shape + audio/haptic).

Bronze: Red/green LEDs paired with icons/text.
Silver: Distinct shapes/symbols added to controls.
Gold: All controls tested with CVD simulation; digital readouts supplement color.

Bronze: Digital signage meets WCAG contrast minimums.
Silver: No color-only graphs; textures/labels/shapes provided.
Gold: WCAG 2.2 compliant; tested with CVD simulators and users.

Bronze: Staff can summon CDI/VRI; comfortable with written/typed exchange.
Silver: Tactile pagers or wearable haptics for critical alerts & pickup.
Gold: Evacuation assistance protocols; tactile maps; escorted orientation on request.

Checklist Item (Raw): Tactile floor 'vibration zones' for proximity awareness
Bronze: Subtle texture changes near high-traffic zones.
Silver: Gentle ribbed/ridge surfaces at key approaches.
Gold: Dynamic floor tactility near transitions/decisions where feasible.

Bronze: Use glass where privacy isn't critical.
Silver: Translucent/scrim partitions show motion behind.
Gold: Partitioned zones maintain visual awareness without privacy loss.

Bronze: Use warm, even light; avoid extreme casts.
Silver: Finishes that enhance contrast on faces/hands.
Gold: Tunable lighting to maximize sign legibility.

Bronze: Shield critical wiring near assistive systems.
Silver: Keep RF emitters away from gathering areas.
Gold: Comms systems designed to mitigate device interference.

Bronze: Mirrored/repeated corridor patterns for orientation.
Silver: Tactile markers/landmarks at regular intervals.
Gold: Geometry supports mirrored navigation to reduce cognitive load.

Bronze: Unique tactile marker on each door.
Silver: Add high-contrast accents.
Gold: Markers align with wayfinding logic; described in digital maps/QR.

Bronze: At least one quiet wellness room per floor/zone.
Silver: Spaces with dimmable lighting, sound insulation, soft finishes.
Gold: Distributed retreat rooms with controllable lighting, seating, sensory tools.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | Sensory Rooms | Wellness/Lactation | Work Floor

Bronze: Simple icons and plain language.
Silver: Visual schedules/flowcharts for common tasks.
Gold: Pictogram-based navigation; personalized digital routes.

Bronze: Flicker-free LED (no fluorescents).
Silver: Dimmable, indirect lighting in open offices/retreat rooms.
Gold: User-controlled sensory presets in work zones.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Sensory Rooms | Wellness/Lactation | Work Floor

Bronze: Pen/paper and text workflow at service desks.
Silver: Tablets with AAC apps at staffed counters.
Gold: Enterprise AAC integration across platforms.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | Kitchenette (Work Floor) | Work Floor

Bronze: Quiet seating near social hubs.
Silver: Designated low-arousal social zones.
Gold: Events/spaces with quiet breakout areas and alternate engagement modes.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | Event Spaces | IT/AV & Kiosks | Work Floor

Bronze: Basic staff orientation on neurodiverse strategies.
Silver: Annual refreshers for managers/HR/FOH.
Gold: Training co-created with neurodiverse employees; annual evaluation.

Bronze: Primary and secondary circulation routes identified.
Silver: Maps highlight quieter pathways/elevators.
Gold: Digital navigation offers 'quiet route' options with sensors.

Bronze: Task lights at workstations.
Silver: Independent dimming of zones in rooms/work areas.
Gold: Personalized light presets via app/building system.

Bronze: Quiet vs. active areas separated.
Silver: Acoustic buffers between noisy and quiet zones.
Gold: Noise sensors with real-time feedback on signage/apps.

Bronze: Avoid high-gloss/glare finishes.
Silver: Low-odor, low-VOC, non-squeak materials.
Gold: Palette screened with sensory-user testing.

Bronze: Fragrance-free cleaning supplies.
Silver: Scheduled quiet hours in communal spaces.
Gold: Dynamic operation model adapting for sensory comfort.

Checklist Item (Raw): Layered, flexible lighting for diverse needs
Bronze: Provide task lights so overheads can be dimmed.
Silver: Zoned seating with brighter and dimmer areas; signage indicates options.
Gold: Dynamic lighting presets (bright/calm/balanced) with app-based control; glare-free ambient design.

Bronze: Quiet pods or visual partitions in open office.
Silver: Dedicated heads-down zones with acoustic/visual shielding.
Gold: Choice model: libraries, pods, quiet floors, private booths.

Bronze: Analog clocks visible in shared areas.
Silver: Meeting rooms with countdown timers/progress bars.
Gold: Personalized reminders and dashboards synced to devices.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | IT/AV & Kiosks | Meeting Room | Work Floor

Bronze: Plain language with bullet summaries.
Silver: Consistent templates across signage and updates.
Gold: Multi-channel comms with user preference settings.

Bronze: Standing desks or walking routes provided.
Silver: Indoor/outdoor reset spaces for short breaks.
Gold: Structured movement breaks and wellness nooks.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Entrance | Exterior & Paths | Parking/Loading | Sensory Rooms | Wellness/Lactation | Work Floor

Bronze: Clear agendas for meetings.
Silver: Enterprise guidance on time management and clear comms.
Gold: Policy commits to neurodiverse participation (shorter, clear, written follow-up).
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | IT/AV & Kiosks | Meeting Room | Work Floor

Bronze: Plain language + icons for signage/notices.
Silver: Layered info (headline first, details later).
Gold: Annual cognitive-access audit by neurodiverse employees.

Bronze: Logical, sequential room numbering.
Silver: Symbols/pictograms alongside numbers.
Gold: Redundant system (text + icon + shape + digital overlay).

Bronze: Floors/themes linked to colors or icons.
Silver: Wings given distinct identities via landmarks.
Gold: Building-wide mnemonic design aiding recall.

Bronze: Avoid dense paragraphs; use short lines/spacing.
Silver: Sans-serif/dyslexia-friendly fonts by default in templates.
Gold: Plain-language defaults for signage/print/digital.

Bronze: At least one quiet and one collaborative area per floor.
Silver: Zones of regulation: quiet/focus/collaboration/energizing.
Gold: Real-time occupancy/sensory data displayed for choice.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | IT/AV & Kiosks | Work Floor

Bronze: Slides + verbal narration provided.
Silver: Plain-text handouts and visuals available.
Gold: Multi-modal by default (text/visual/audio/digital).
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | IT/AV & Kiosks | Meeting Room | Work Floor

Bronze: 32″ minimum clear width.
Silver: ≥ 36″ continuous clear passage primary routes.
Gold: ≥ 40–42″ all routes; ≥ 48″ high-traffic corridors.

Bronze: 60″ turning diameter at nodes.
Silver: ≥ 67″ turning diameter in corridors/rooms.
Gold: ≥ 83″ turning radius at intersections/lobbies.

Bronze: 32″ clear with lever handles.
Silver: 36″ clear using swing-clear hinges; auto-openers on key doors.
Gold: Sliding or powered doors; no door swing reducing width.

Bronze: Thresholds ≤ ½″ beveled.
Silver: Flush or ≤ ¼″ transitions everywhere.
Gold: All thresholds flush; resilient/ramped transitions at every joint.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Elevators/Stairs | Entrance | Work Floor

Bronze: Wall-mounted objects project ≤ 4″.
Silver: Mounted features recessed/protected; corridors ≥ 36″ clear at all times.
Gold: No protrusions; protective rails/furnishings preserve clearances.

Bronze: At least one 36″ route through rooms.
Silver: Main aisles ≥ 42″ and nodes 60″ turning.
Gold: Modular layouts; multiple approach options to tables/seats.

Bronze: Accessible loading with level landings.
Silver: Drop-off/refuge sized for 30–32″ chairs with 60″ turning.
Gold: Refuge and lobbies designed for ≥ 40″ chair widths plus margin; bariatric tested.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Elevators/Stairs | Parking/Loading | Work Floor

Bronze: Carpet pile ≤ ½″, firm pad, securely fastened.
Silver: Smooth, low-resistance surfaces in primary paths; no 'bumpy' textures.
Gold: Surfaces tested for low vibration and minimal push-force; user-vetted.

Bronze: Avoid highly reflective/glossy flooring.
Silver: No busy/high-contrast linear patterns in circulation zones.
Gold: Designs reviewed for neuro/low-vision comfort; matte finishes in high-traffic zones.

Bronze: Slip-resistant per ANSI/NFSI.
Silver: Transitions color-contrasted but not patterned to avoid illusions.
Gold: Universal flooring palette: matte, low-glare, high-contrast edges at hazards; user testing.

Bronze: Power-assist or slow-close doors ≥ 5 s delay.
Silver: Hold-open ≥ 8 s; sensors detect slower entry.
Gold: Automated doors with adjustable dwell times everywhere primary.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | Entrance | Work Floor

Checklist Item (Raw): Access control & turnstiles for slower pace
Bronze: At least one wide-access gate with reader.
Silver: Gate speed adjustable; reader positioned for easy reach.
Gold: Frictionless entry or sensor-based credentials; all points accessible.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | Entrance | Security/Access Control | Work Floor

Bronze: Trays and table surfaces at multiple heights.
Silver: Tray slides or staff assistance available on request.
Gold: Wheeled tray tables; attachable trays for mobility aids; staffed support.

Bronze: Seating/rest spots every 150 ft.
Silver: Seating with arms/backrests every 100 ft; leaning rails provided.
Gold: Continuous network of rest spots; weather-protected near entries/exits.

Bronze: Paths clear of loose rugs/cords.
Silver: High slip resistance and shock-absorbing materials.
Gold: Fall-prevention lens: uncluttered, slip-proof, redundant handholds.
Spaces: Corridors & Circulation | Event Spaces | IT/AV & Kiosks | Work Floor

Bronze: Pen/paper and digital typing at reception/help points.
Silver: Standardized icon communication boards at service desks.
Gold: Real-time STT/TTS kiosks or apps deployed across sites.
Spaces: Exterior & Paths | IT/AV & Kiosks | Lobby | Parking/Loading | Reception Desks | Work Floor

Bronze: Basic awareness of speech impairments.
Silver: Staff trained to use AAC tools; patient listening strategies.
Gold: Organization-wide training; communication access accreditation.

Bronze: Key policies/safety info in easy-read format.
Silver: Maps/instructions/signage use plain language + symbols.
Gold: Full comms accessibility: plain text, pictograms, audio/visual guides.

Bronze: Clear numbering and color coding.
Silver: Consistent redundant cues (icons/photos/arrows).
Gold: Personalized wayfinding apps with step-by-step and prompts.

Bronze: At least one low-stimulation room in larger offices.
Silver: Multiple calm zones with trauma-sensitive lighting/sound.
Gold: Integrated wellness rooms; staff trained for PTSD/mental health crises.

Bronze: Clear sightlines on circulation routes.
Silver: Avoid hidden corners; use glass/open design for predictability.
Gold: Customizable routes to avoid crowded/triggering spaces.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | Sensory Rooms | Wellness/Lactation | Work Floor

Bronze: Step-free routes between key functions.
Silver: Shortest accessible route clearly marked/maintained.
Gold: Dynamic signage/apps highlight least-energy paths.

Bronze: Benches/chairs every 150 ft.
Silver: Reclining rest chairs and hydration stations.
Gold: Dedicated recovery rooms with privacy, climate control, med storage.

Bronze: High-contrast signage; non-slip floors; increased lighting levels.
Silver: Seating with arms; extra handrails; reduced-glare finishes.
Gold: Universal upgrades for hearing/vision/mobility across all facilities.

Bronze: Avoid flashing lights over 3 Hz.
Silver: All emergency strobes tested for epilepsy safety.
Gold: Systems certified photosensitive epilepsy safe.

Bronze: Refrigeration for personal medications in larger workplaces.
Silver: Flexible break policies for condition management.
Gold: Wellness staff trained in invisible disability support.

Checklist Item (Raw): Countertop/shelf for personal medical care (ostomy, etc.)
Bronze: At least one accessible restroom includes cleanable shelf/countertop at seated height.
Silver: Counters in multiple restrooms (men's, women's, all-gender) with nearby disposal.
Gold: All-gender restrooms with private stalls, durable counters, medical waste bins, sanitation.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Kitchenette (Work Floor) | Restrooms | Work Floor

Bronze: One family room accessible with child seating.
Silver: Accessible counters, multi-height changing stations, stroller routes.
Gold: All-gender family suites with adult changing tables, private feeding, child-safe furnishings.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Corridors & Circulation | Kitchenette (Work Floor) | Work Floor

Bronze: Some armless seating; chairs rated 400+ lbs.
Silver: Bariatric toilets, reinforced grab bars, wider showers/lockers.
Gold: Standard fixtures/furniture selected for higher capacities with dignity.

Bronze: Relief area onsite with safe, non-slip flooring.
Silver: Relief areas on multiple floors/zones; water stations.
Gold: Comprehensive service-animal policy; designated support/rest areas.
Spaces: Exterior & Paths | Parking/Loading | Service Animal Relief Area

Bronze: Fragrance-free cleaning products in core areas.
Silver: Low-VOC paints/adhesives/finishes in all renovations.
Gold: Fragrance-free policy; certified materials; air purification systems.

Bronze: Printed wayfinding/emergency instructions alongside digital.
Silver: Paging/alerting with physical + digital redundancy.
Gold: All smart systems have low/no-tech equivalents (tactile maps, paper schedules).

Bronze: At least one fully accessible all-gender restroom.
Silver: Multiple accessible all-gender restrooms per floor/zone.
Gold: All restrooms meet full accessibility + privacy/dignity for all identities.

Bronze: Quiet rooms signed; avoid unnecessary loud noises.
Silver: Trauma-informed design: clear exits, controlled alarms.
Gold: Veteran peer-support room/affinity space in wellness offerings.

Bronze: Visible info on veteran resources.
Silver: Partnerships with veteran orgs.
Gold: Recruitment/mentorship/accommodations program embedded in policy.

Bronze: Neutral quiet space available.
Silver: Ablution/washing area, clocks, storage for mats/books.
Gold: Multiple culturally-responsive rooms across campus with scheduling.

Bronze: Refrigeration for personal religious items.
Silver: Clear labeling of allergens/pork/alcohol; vegetarian/halal/kosher options.
Gold: Vendors certified to provide compliant options site-wide.
Spaces: Café/Dining | Exterior & Paths | Parking/Loading | Prayer Rooms

Bronze: Art/imagery represent diverse cultures.
Silver: Co-curated with employees/community.
Gold: Rotating exhibitions/events celebrating multiple identities.
Spaces: Event Spaces | IT/AV & Kiosks | Work Floor

Bronze: Locker/restrooms allow privacy for grooming.
Silver: Water stations, mirrors, outlets for varied hair-care needs.
Gold: PPE/uniform policy supports protective hairstyles; inclusive grooming policy.

Bronze: Floating holidays available.
Silver: Scheduling respects major non-dominant holidays.
Gold: Enterprise calendar integrates global observances.

Bronze: Key signage in multiple languages per demographics.
Silver: Interpreter/translation for HR and safety comms.
Gold: Multilingual real-time digital systems (apps/displays/alerts).
